reviews.review: Arkadaşım önermişti ve oynadıktan sonra bağımlısı oldum resmen yıllar geçsede hiç eskimeyen efsane bir oyun.
One of the best games of all time. Defitnitly play it

Portal 2 - Jednoznačně úžasná hra s jednoduchým konceptem a spoustou zábavy. Jedná se o logickou puzzle hru s principem vytváření portálů. Hra nabízí jak režim pro jednotlivce, tak i pro více hráčů. Pokud stejně jako já nemáte žádné přátele nezoufejte! Příběhový režim je úžasné dílo plné zábavy, logiky a skvělého závěrečného zvratu. Pokud se po dohrání této příběhové bomby rozhodnete vrhnout do režimu pro více hráčů, tak určitě neuděláte chybu. Jedná se totiž doslovně o kooperativní režim, ve kterém je potřeba spolupracovat k dosažení zářných výsledků. Celou hrou vás provádí Glados, která na váš účet po celou dobu hraní sype zábavné poznámky. Hře bych zvládl vytknout jedinou věc a to málo obsahu. Ačkoliv je tato hra velice nadčasová a úžasně zpracovaná, je možné ji dohrát ve velice krátkém intervalu. Tento malý nedostatek ovšem vynahrazuje cena hry, která během slev padá až na hodnotu kolem 3 eur. Pokud tety máte pár přebytečných eur ve své steam peněžence, tak hru doporučuji na 100%. 10/10

Very enjoyable game, would definitely recommend it

If you liked Portal 1, then you will really enjoy Portal 2 even more! The game is fun and challenging to play which is amplified in co-op play. Valve really made a timeless game that has memorable characters (Wheatley has to be one of the best characters ever made in a video game), a great story, great graphics and fun/challenging gameplay... This game is definitely worth your time even in 2022 (11 years after release)!
Одна из лучший игр от Valve, головоломки и сюжет просто 100/100

Great fun but gets really confusing sometimes, a must play with a friend

This is honestly one of the best games you will ever play. The puzzles are fun and at times, can be challenging. It's a perfect mix of what a valve game should be, both very funny and entertaining to play, but also has a great story that makes people want to play it again, and again. Another thing that lots of people overlook is the soundtrack for the game, adding so so much to the feeling of levels in the game. Even after the story mode, the community workshop has prolonged this game's life span by a significant amount, giving people thousands of different maps to play through. This is a classic must have game and I will continue to play it for years to come.
Just a cool game. Bigger map and more stuff to do than Portal 1

Man... so much fun... puzzles that if you take your time you can figure out and just such a fun story. Why did I wait so long?

I first acquired this game in 2013 on the Xbox 360 and this was, and still is, the most immersive, interactive, mind boggling and hilarious game I have ever played to this day. The joy that came with my purchase of this game at a local best buy was well worth the money my dad spent on it. It took me weeks to finish this game on my first attempt. I got stuck at seemingly every level but not the stuck as in not knowing what to do. My adolescence mind was troubled by the difficulty of the puzzle presented in the game so i never got very far. The point where i finally stepped away from this game is chapter 6 "The Fall" where i was clueless on how to progress further. I tried many things to fly through the aperture logo but all attempts in vain. No matter the determination I displayed, not once did I fly through the aperture logo. It was on a night after school, I had just gotten home and got on my Xbox 360 and decided not to play Minecraft, and instead play Portal 2. I had finally gotten past the levels before the long cutscene which was very challenging for my younger self. I was like most others, surprised when your part-time companion "Wheatly" betrays you and sends you down a dark deep hole that leads to the salt mines. After the dialogue with Caroline and having a brief moment of understanding and bond despite her rude manner, she leaves the moment you meet, by a bird. When i looked around this new and exiting place that i was bashed into, I realized a change in the games pace and a somewhat high spike of difficulty. When I wandered around for a while I found the place where i needed to be, where Cave Johnsons voice echoed around you which game a sort of unease around this new character. Who is this guy? Is what everyone playing this game blind was thinking to themselves. Trying to solve this puzzle was like trying to solve a Rubix cube, I could never get the amount of velocity necessary to fly over to the exit door, then, after 3 days of attempting the same puzzle, I quit, gave up and accepted that this game is too hard for me.

I was browsing the steam sales page when boom! portal 2 was under $2. I recalled the time i had played this game before and I knew that i had to do one thing for sure, I needed to beat this game. after getting my dad to purchase this game once more I prepared myself for the task that i could not finish many years ago, to end a story that should have been ended long ago. I eagerly awaited for the game to download and launched it as soon as the download was complete. I saw the start up screen and noticed how serene and calm I felt, like this game was the answer to a question that i didn't know of. It felt like it filled a hole that was so small and insignificant that it has been ignored for many years. I started a new game and was determined to finish without fail. I remembered most levels and flew through the first half of the game, when I reached the part that gave me the most trouble, what made me quit playing this game back in early 2014, prepared this time to finish I meticulously took note of my surroundings. The white walls, their position and how they can be used. I went to the scaffolding near the roof and placed the portals in the correct places and jumped off, finally finishing that one part I could not all those years back.

Then i finished the game, lol. Was extremely fun! The replayability is insane!

THIS
GAME.
